comments.body:
```suggestion
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
  entry_points:
    - iscan=iscan.scan:main
```

@marcelotrevisani Thanks for the suggestion! Do I still need to specify an entry point in the recipe if I already have one specified in my [setup.py](https://github.com/ZhengnanZhao/iscan/blob/master/setup.py#L26)? I'm inclined to say yes, since `setup.py` isn't included in PyPI tarball this recipe is sourcing from; therefore, conda-build isn't aware of the existence of `setup.py` and by extension this entry point, unless explicitly specified in the recipe, as you suggested. Is that correct?

For console scripts you will need to specify those
Please see
https://conda-forge.org/docs/maintainer/knowledge_base.html#noarch-python

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@  noarch: python
  number: 0
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
  entry_points:
    - iscan = iscan.scan:main

comments.body: You are not packaging the license on ``pypi``, you will need to manually add it
